intro: Thesium burkei, commonly known as the yellow thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to parts of Australia and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Thesium burkei is an erect perennial herb that produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
